page.title: 06Family Life-N.W.Edinburgh
page.content: In the mornings, Tracy's{mother}comes} in at eight o'clock from her work as a cleaner. She makes the breakfast, and wakens Tracy and her{brother.}At 8.30{father}goes to his job in a fish shop, while the children set off for school. On Saturdays, Tracy waves to her{dad as he leaves for work, then watches cartoons on T.V. or video until lunch time. In the afternoon{mum}takes them out to spend their pocket money. After Church on Sundays, the family goes to visit their{grandparents. Their{grandfather}has been unemployed since he lost his job in Leith Docks, but{grandmother}works as a home help. {Uncle Jack}brings Amanda and Jamie for lunch too, and the{cousins}enjoy playing together for the rest of the day.
